titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky V. T. J. Clarke, Judgment
CWG9355

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Ky Plff
agt } for suffering gaming
T J Clarke Deft

This day came the attorney for the Commonwealth and the defendant entered a plea of not guilty and thereupon came a Jury trial C, A, Vancleve, J A Jaiber, Wm M Brecken A K Young, John Beaver, James Elder Harvey McElroy, Q M Chandler, Felix McAtee, Bert Wheatley B V Hamilton and George Dunn were sworn to try the issue and after hearing the Evidence retired and returned into court the following verdict to wit, "We of the Jury find the defendant guilty as charged in the within indictment and assess the fine $200,00 it is therefore adjudged that Said defendant make his fine to the Commonwealth by the payment of $200,00 the amount by the Jury in their verdict aforesaid assessed and also the costs herein expended and that he may be taken &c

A Copy attest
N. T. Berry Ck
by R. J. Simms D. C.
